args: This must be the village in the Mistell\ndiocese where Tobias was dispatched.
I pray I can find something here\nwhich might prove his innocence.
Look there! See that halo she wears?\nShe's with the Church!
You Ilia types got no business\nin this here village!
No, wait! Listen to me, good people!\nI have not come here to cause you ill!
We've no need of your Church here.\nNow leave before you can't walk!
Shoulda listened to me, girly. Haaaah!
I'll fill you in on the whole story later.\nRight now, we gotta split—and fast!
*pant* Okay, we should be safe now.
My thanks, Curran. But if I may ask again,\nwhat brings you to this place?
Same thing that brought you, I imagine:\nI'm looking for the truth.
Tobias isn't telling anyone the most\nimportant part of his story.
You mean WHY he attacked the dragon?
That's it. The higher-ups just wanna light\nhim up and get it over with, but I never\ncould leave a mystery unsolved.
Because if you know the truth,\nthe truth shall bet your peas!
...Er, yes. Right. Regardless, I believe\nI understand why you are here.
Thanks for not... You know. Making a\nbig deal of that last bit there.
Anyway, what's your take on that village?
A den for heretics, mostlike. They set upon\nme the moment they saw my halo.
I don't blame you for thinking that,\nbut these folks have actually never\nbeen accused of heresy.
In fact, until recently, they welcomed both\npriest and Paladyn with open arms.
Then why have they suddenly branded\nthe Church as their enemy?
It started when Tobias was arrested.
Once that happened, their stance\non the Church changed overnight.

That's why I thought I might learn
something here, but... Well, it's
hard to learn when you're busy
running for your life.
Forget filling me in on what happened—\nthey won't even let me into the village.\nI'm a bit out of ideas here, to be honest.
Actually, I may have an idea.\nMight I speak with Tobias again?
If we cannot get information from the\nvillagers, we've no choice but to\nget it from the man himself.
Only inquisitors are allowed to speak\nto people charged with heresy.
Buuuut...this sounds like our only option.\nAnd if anyone can get that bird to sing,\nit's most likely you.
Still, are you sure you want to do this?\nIf the higher-ups learn about this plan,\nwe're both gonna be in a world of hurt.
I seek only to know the truth of this matter,\nand accept the consequences of my action.
I've been assigned a new inquisitor, eh?
That's right. Anyway, I'll just let\nthe two of you get acquainted.

I apologize for wasting your time,
inquisitor, but I have nothing to tell
you that I haven't already told your
comrade in arms.
So I suggest you lea... YOU!
Explain yourself, Elisanne!\nWhat are you doing here?!
I have just returned from that village.
They are attacking members of the Church.\nHas the whole village turned heretic?
Or is this related to the conflict between\nthe conservatives and perditionists?
That village has nothing to do with our\nconflict, and no bias towards either side.
And even if they were a village of \nperditionists, they would have no\nreason to help me.
Is this related to the time you saved me?
I know you well enough to think there is\nmore to this story. Above all, you have\never wished for the happiness of everyone.
So if you are claiming to have become a\nheretic, I reject that notion utterly.
Tell me, Paladyn: What is heresy to you?\nWhat constitutes a proper faith?
Indeed. If it were, the Church would\nnot be divided as it is now.
Still, this division has taught us\none thing: Faith is not constant.
To enact change, one must discard old\ntraditions. That is why I took up my blade.
Then you attacked that dragon\nbecause of some new faith?
Beliefs that take the lives of the innocent\nmust be cast aside, or we shall never\nknow true happiness.
What beliefs are you talking about?\nWhat is your ultimate aim here?
...Very well. As you swore to aim for the\nsame ideals as me, I shall tell you.
Now come. Make yourself comfortable,\nand let me tell you of lives stolen away\nby outdated and rotten beliefs...
